intro: Atractylis cancellata var. typica, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions. The varietal form typica is distinguished by its specific leaf and flower morphology compared to other varieties of Atractylis cancellata.
